instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1932: What is A1932? A1932 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2018, 2019 with EMC 3184, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01521..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.P5VG3S_EN: What is P5VG3S_EN? This signal enables the PP5V_G3S power rail when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No power 5 or 20v
threads.message:
Hello, I am working on a Macbook air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> model that came with water damage around <TRANSISTOR>Q7660</TRANSISTOR> which I already replaced.

Symptoms are if I plug in the board only without a battery I get 5V 0.01A if I plug in the battery, I get 20V 0.02A

I did the followings :
Measured <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> Are ok but <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3</SIGNAL> is missing.
Check for short circuit which I cant find.
I tried DFU mode to revive or restore.
I checked the current on <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>. They get 5V on <SIGNAL>CHGR_EN_MVR_R</SIGNAL>
Replaced the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
<SIGNAL>P5VG3S_EN</SIGNAL> I get nothing.
Replaced the audio board as it had some corrosion

It is still the same, not turning on at all.

Is there any hint that can help me to sort out this issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No power 5 or 20v
threads.message:
Check voltage and diode mode to ground on the 4 LDOs of both <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips.
Be aware, 1V1 LDO must only appear on the powered port.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No power 5 or 20v
threads.message:
I checked all the voltages are ok.
The diode mode is around 0.500 on all

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No power 5 or 20v
threads.message:
Do you get 1V1 LDO on both ports for sure?
DFU ended  with error, or completed?

Post diode mode readings on J6100, at pins 32 & 33.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No power 5 or 20v
threads.message:
I do get 1V1
J6100
Pin 32  0.713 
Pin 33 0.395

I can't get to go into DFU. It was not even recognized when I connected the cable to the host Mac. I got a thunderbolt that can`t be used. I tried few different cables

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No power 5 or 20v
threads.message:
Be sure to use dedicated DFU port.

Check AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages; the samll coils around <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>.
Also test without audio flex connected, nor battery.
